com.ibm.ecm.api.coresdk.model.http

Interface IBMECMRequest


  • public interface IBMECMRequest
    Represents custom HTTP requests that can be made directly to services in IBM Content Navigator.

    This class can be used to connect to plugin services (custom services from plugin extension) or any other services that this SDK has yet to support. These requests will benefit from common login, retry, and error-handling capabilities that the SDK already supports. This includes adding in the appropriate securityToken header.

    These custom requests can be created by our IBMECMRequestFactory class. 

    IBMECMRequest request = IBMECMRequestFactory.getInstance().getRequest()

    • Nested Class Summary

      The HTTP method to be used.

    • Method Detail

      • setContentType

        void setContentType(String contentType)
        Sets the content type header for this request. The default content-type will be "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".
        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type header for this request

      • setUserAgent

        void setUserAgent(String userAgent)
        Sets user agent of this request. By default, the user-agent will be "IBM Navigator Mobile" (for mobile) and "IBMNavigatorDesktopSDK" (for everything else).
        Parameters:
        userAgent - the user-agent to set for this request. A user-agent is used to identify who is making this request.

      • setQueryParameters

        void setQueryParameters(Map<String,String> queryParameters)
        Set query parameters of this request. Query parameters are used to construct a single query string that will be passed along with the request.

        This is typically done for a IBMECMRequest.HTTPMethod.GET request

        Parameters:
        queryParameters - the query parameters for this request such as field1=value&field2=value2

      • getRequestHeaders

        Map<String,String> getRequestHeaders()
        Returns a map of all the request headers set on this request.
        Returns:
        a map of all the request headers set on this request

      • addRequestHeaders

        void addRequestHeaders(Map<String,String> requestHeaders)
        Add additional HTTP headers to this request.
        Parameters:
        requestHeaders - a map of all the request headers toa dd to this request

      • setRequestBody

        void setRequestBody(Map<String,String> postParameters)
        Sets the request body with post parameters. These post parameters will automatically be encoded.

        This is typically done for a IBMECMRequest.HTTPMethod.POST request

        Parameters:
        postParameters - a map of post parameters to set as the request body

      • getQueryURL

        URL getQueryURL()
        Returns the query URL string of this request.
        Returns:
        the query URL string of this request.

      • submit

        IBMECMResponse submit()
               throws IBMECMRuntimeException
        Submits this request synchronously and returns a IBMECMResponse object when the call is finished. This call will block until a response returns or an error occurs.
        Returns:
        the HTTP response object from this request call
        Throws:
        IBMECMRuntimeException - if any error occurs during the call

      • submit

        IBMECMRequestCall submit(IBMECMResponseCallBack responseCallBack)
        Submits this request asynchronously. This method call will not wait for the request call to complete.

        Use the IBMECMRequestCall object to cancel the call. Use the IBMECMResponseCallBack object to obtain the results of this request call.

        Parameters:
        responseCallBack - the response callback that will be called when this request finishes. It will call IBMECMResponseCallBack.onSuccess(IBMECMResponse) with the http response object on a successful completion and IBMECMResponseCallBack.onFailure(IBMECMRuntimeException) when an error occurs.
        Returns:
        the IBMECMRequestCall object. You can use this to cancel the request if necessary.

      • submitMultipartCall

        IBMECMRequestCall submitMultipartCall(String inputSourceName,
                                      InputStream inputSourceStream,
                                      long inputSourceLength,
                                      String mimeType,
                                      IBMECMResponseCallBack responseCallBack,
                                      IBMECMServerProgressListener progressListener)
        Submits this request as a multipart HTTP request asynchronously to upload content to the server. This method call will not wait for the request call to complete.

        If you need to upload post parameters as well, use setRequestBody(Map) to set the parameters and then submit with this call.

        Parameters:
        inputSourceName - the name of the input source or file name
        inputSourceStream - the input stream of the file to upload
        inputSourceLength - the length of the input source. Specify -1 if it's undermined
        mimeType - the mimetype of the input stource
        responseCallBack - the response callback that will be called when this request finishes. It will call IBMECMResponseCallBack.onSuccess(IBMECMResponse) with the http response object on a successful completion and IBMECMResponseCallBack.onFailure(IBMECMRuntimeException) when an error occurs.
        progressListener - the progress listener for this upload request. You can pass in null to avoid listening.
        Returns:
        the IBMECMRequestCall object. Users can use this to cancel the request if necessary.

      • submitMultipartCall

        IBMECMResponse submitMultipartCall(String inputSourceName,
                                   InputStream inputSourceStream,
                                   long inputSourceLength,
                                   String mimeType,
                                   IBMECMServerProgressListener progressListener)
                            throws IBMECMRuntimeException
        Submits this request as a multipart HTTP request synchronously to upload content to the server. This call will block until a response returns or an error occurs.

        If you need to upload post parameters as well, use setRequestBody(Map) to set the parameters and then submit with this call.

        Parameters:
        inputSourceName - the name of the input source or file name
        inputSourceStream - the input stream of the file to upload
        inputSourceLength - the length of the input source. Specify -1 if it's undermined
        mimeType - the mimetype of the input stource
        progressListener - the progress listener for this upload request. You can pass in null to avoid listening.
        Returns:
        the HTTP response object from this request call
        Throws:
        IBMECMRuntimeException
